They have an actual police station on campus for the safety of the students.
They have various clubs you can attend.
They are a very diverse campus and they have students that help other students.
Northside as the theatre where you can enjoy yourself and the SAC has a gym and weight room.
This school is worth it if you put everything you got into your education (dedication and hard work).
There is a work out room and a gym where you can do various activities. They have a theatre where you can go watch plays and different other shows.
they have three different places where you can dine. there are very spacious so there is no crowding.
They have nice size dorms for students who live on campus. There are safety doors so only students can get in.
it's a good college to graduate from. You can always find that the professors are helpful and good at what they do.
This is a very good school; they have people that are willing to work with people one on one and they have different degree opportunities.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {174206=The professors are knowledgable, but the thoroughness of the advisors is questionable. I emailed and called my advisor more times than i can remember and never recieved a response. if you want to talk to your advisor you have to march into their office and demand a meeting., 84652=The dining area was just redone in 2012. It not only is a good place to eat, it's also nice to study. There are several options available at lunch time., 63085=IUSB just re-did The Grille and I must say that the food is very good and worth the price ! The Grille closes at 2:30 p.m so most students go to the SAC cafe and enjoy snacks, if all else fails, they are plenty of vending machines., 207467=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: IUSB won't give you a campus experience like other bigger colleges. There isn't much to do as far as on campus activities. Am learning a lot I am currently a freshman majoring in Mechanical Engineering. I am learning a lot from these classes. Login to rate or flag the reviews Tori from South Bend, IN 09/15/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 49 Categories Comments Tips for prospective students I would strongly suggest that prospective students come for a visit to the Univeristy. The Office of Admissions offers campus visits 4 days each week where you receive a guided tour of campus from a current student and have the chance to sit down with an admissions counselor one-on-one. There are also Showcase Days offered once each month where students can come for a visit and have the chance to speak with someone from the major they are interested in. Coming for a visit will help students
